newsitem.title: USA: Union Pacific sets final proration factor.
newsitem.headline: Union Pacific sets final proration factor.

text.p: Union Pacific Corp said Monday a final proration factor of 0.803772507 was set in connection with the September 11 merger of Southern Pacific Rail Corp into a subsidiary of Union Pacific.
This factor will be multiplied by the number of Southern Pacific shares for which each shareholder made a valid stock election, Union Pacific explained.

In accordance with the merger agreement, the resulting number of Southern Pacific shares will be converted into shares of Union Pacific common stock at a ratio of 0.4065 of a share of Union Pacific stock for each Southern Pacific share.
All other Southern Pacific shares will be exchanged for cash at the rate of $25 per share. Cash will be paid in lieu of any fractional Union Pacific share at $72.0688 per share.
Union Pacific said it will pay the cash consideration on September 16, 1996 and will mail Union Pacific stock certificates shortly thereafter.
